page.title: 04CHELFORD CATTLE MARKET
page.content: {Chelford cattle market. When we went to Chelford market we interviewed some people.One person had come from as far as Sheffield,45 miles away.Some had come from Manchester and St.Helens. Most people we asked came only on Mondays but a few came also on Wednesdays.A dairy cow costs Â£500,a fat pig Â£60 and a sheep Â£20(for more prices see page 6).Not many people came from Chelford, nearly all coming more than 4 miles. Most people were selling but a few were buying.On Mondays they bring live stock for auction.On Wednesdays they bring hay and straw and on Thursday nights they sell plants. There are also stalls selling boots and water-proof clothing. Every month there are two machinary sales selling tractors and farm implements.The market is just North of the railway station.
